intro: Coffea welwitschii, commonly known as the Welwitsch coffee, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the coastal regions of Angola and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant produces red, fleshy berries that contain the coffee beans used for brewing. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 2 meters and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its unique flavor profile, it is considered a specialty coffee variety.
